conclusion: Understanding the flow of liquid through baffles to predict which container it will flow into.
Baffles are designed to redirect the flow of liquid.
The direction of the baffles will determine the path the liquid takes.
Liquid from A is directed by the brown baffle towards the left side.
Liquid from A will flow into container D.
Liquid from B is directed by the green baffle towards the right side.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
Liquid from C is directed by the orange baffle towards the right side.
Liquid from C will flow into container E.
Liquid from A will flow into container D; Liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
